str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
